      • checkSpeculatableTasks

        public boolean checkSpeculatableTasks()
        Check for tasks to be speculated and return true if there are any. This is called periodically by the TaskScheduler.

        TODO: To make this scale to large jobs, we need to maintain a list of running tasks, so that we don't scan the whole task set. It might also help to make this sorted by launch time.

      • getLocalityIndex

        public int getLocalityIndex(scala.Enumeration.Value locality)
        Find the index in myLocalityLevels for a given locality. This is also designed to work with localities that are not in myLocalityLevels (in case we somehow get those) by returning the next-biggest level we have. Uses the fact that the last value in myLocalityLevels is ANY.

      • handleTaskGettingResult

        public void handleTaskGettingResult(long tid)

        public void handleFailedTask(long tid,

                    TaskEndReason reason)
        Marks the task as failed, re-adds it to the list of pending tasks, and notifies the DAG Scheduler.

      • abort

        public void abort(String message)

      • addRunningTask

        public void addRunningTask(long tid)
        If the given task ID is not in the set of running tasks, adds it.

        Used to keep track of the number of running tasks, for enforcing scheduling policies.

      • removeRunningTask

        public void removeRunningTask(long tid)
        If the given task ID is in the set of running tasks, removes it.
